Class WordSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordSearch

  • public class WordSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    This class, WordSearch, with the help of the PuzzleReader class and a Puzzle text file (see PuzzleReader Docs), lets the user play a game of word search.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main Procedure

      • printPuzzle

        public static void printPuzzle(char[][] board,
                               java.lang.String[] hiddenWords)
        Prints the puzzle and the number of hidden words.
        Parameters:
        board - Puzzle to be printed.
        hiddenWords - Words hidden in the puzzle.
        Requires
        hiddenWords != null and board is a valid matrix.

      • isValidGame

        public static boolean isValidGame(char[][] board,
                                  java.lang.String[] hiddenWords)
        Determines if the puzzle is valid, that is, all given words are hidden in the puzzle.
        Parameters:
        board - Puzzle.
        hiddenWords - Words to search for in the puzzle.
        Returns:
        true if the puzzle is valid, false if otherwise.
        Requires
        hiddenWords != null and board is a valid matrix.
        Ensures
        \return == true || \return == false

      • isHidden

        public static boolean isHidden(char[][] board,
                               java.lang.String word)
        Determines if word is hidden in the puzzle, verticaly or horizontally, forwards or backwards.
        Parameters:
        board - Puzzle.
        word - Word to search for in the puzzle.
        Returns:
        true if word is hidden in the puzzle, false if otherwise.
        Requires
        word != null and board is a valid matrix.
        Ensures
        \return == true || \return == false

      • readMove

        public static int[] readMove(java.util.Scanner sc,
                             int rows,
                             int columns)
        Reads the player's next move through the given scanner and determines if said move is valid. If the move isn't valid, prints an error message and attempts to read a new move.
        Parameters:
        sc - Scanner the function will use to read the player's move.
        rows - Number of rows in the puzzle.
        columns - Number of columns in the puzzle.
        Returns:
        An array that contains the player's move.
        Requires
        sc != null && rows > 0 && columns > 0
        Ensures
        isValidMove(\return, rows, colums)

      • isValidMove

        public static boolean isValidMove(int[] move,
                                  int rows,
                                  int columns)
        Determines if the given move is valid. To be valid the move needs to represent a vertical or horizontal line of contiguos positions, from left to right or top to bottom, within the rows and lines of the puzzle.
        Parameters:
        move - Move to validate.
        rows - Number of rows in the puzzle.
        columns - Number of columns in the puzzle.
        Returns:
        true if move is valid, false if otherwise.
        Requires
        move != null && rows > 0 && columns > 0
        Ensures
        \return == true || \return == false

      • findWord

        public static java.lang.String findWord(char[][] board,
                                        int[] move,
                                        java.lang.String[] hiddenWords)
        Determines if a hidden word was found in the position of the given move.
        Parameters:
        board - Puzzle.
        move - Position to search in.
        hiddenWords - Words to search for in the given position.
        Returns:
        Returns a hidden word if it is found in move, or null if none are found.
        Requires
        isValidGame(board, hiddenWords) && isValidMove(move, board.length, board[0].length) and board is a valid matrix.
